message:
Whenever I open a torrent using Vodafone USB modem, the whole connection is cut off (torrent itself and browsing).

I take the modem in and out several times until it works (even the torrent).

This happened too often to call it a coincidence.
Why can an ISP choose what I want to do with my connection? :D

data.message: happens to me during normal usage

According to Fady, it might well be a coincidence. Maybe it's just too unstable.

It might also be something technicians related, not policy / ban related, that is caused in some how to the instability.

The fact that torrent works when you connect again is the most interesting piece.

It's unreliable to torrent over 3G connection anyways as you couldn't get full download speed for direct download meanwhile you need extra third party app to get full speed over 3G , and for torrents it requires high bandwidth , also maybe your ISP throttling torrent ports while speed in usb modem slow so it may appear disconnected

Its extremely weird.
The funny thing, when the connection is back I get the full 700 KB/s

Does anyone know how is the metadata phase different from the download phase?
It seems when I start the torrent (after several trials) I have no issues during the download itself.
Maybe you can try to connect via a VPN. and see how things will go.
